content:
"Chings will rule the world" was a blatantly racist title. I changed it to "Chards will rule the world", but I still think this whole submission is overtly political and trying to exaggerate birth rates between China and the West, while using offensive rhetoric.

As for the clash, it would be better to have some test cases that deal with the case for equality. Validators 2, 3 and 4 all fail if you forget that "overrule" means chard population is > aaron population, not >=.
No test cases deal with this, so you can get 100% on the tests and then only 50% on the validators if you don't think ahead about this. Would be good to swap one of those validators with a test case.
Maybe also make it a bit more clear that the aarons "add [[ar]] more aarons" rather than "reproduce to [[ar]] more aarons" which sounds ambiguous.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and explained really well, fast to do if you understand the problem.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun, unique, added challenge of having to make sure your program doesn't time out (while loop) by guarding it with a condition

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: fun easy clash, almost got over 5 mins because i did not see that chings multiply and aarons add, but that's on me.

Goal section
* Please change "wants" to "want".

* Please change the first "does" to "do".

Output section
* Please change "date" to "day".

* Please format "-1" as a {{constant}}.

Cases
* Please add a test where cr = 0 (currently only covered in validators).

* Please add pairs of tests and validators to cover the situations where a = 0 and ar = 0.

* I don't know how to interpret cr = 0: "reproduce to 0 times its size"?

* cr = 1 is slightly better... "reproduce to 1 times its size" but the original population all dies right after reproduction, I guess...

* Weird test 3: c > a on Day 1, though [[a]] will always be greater than [[c]] on subsequent days. But oh well.

And you write as if "chings" and "aarons" are common nouns. But anyway.

Thanks.

5DNLY level 1 accomplished: Changed wants to want
Changed does to do
Add -1 as constant
Changed date to day
Added cr=0 confusion
Added test 3 confusion
Added chings and aarons as nouns confusion by adding the imaginary world of codingame, because  in the imaginary world of codingame, they're both the most common species found in the imaginary world of codingame (I've been there)

The downvote is not from me, just to be clear.

I mean if cr = 0, then the chings just don't reproduce and die out the next day... that doesn't make sense, but it's an imaginary world. Whatever.

You can delete that note on cr = 0 in Goal section, because I wasn't looking for that clarification.
